author: Stu Woo
title: Are Huawei and ZTE a Real Cybersecurity Threat? - WSJ
text:
The U.S. government’s remarkable campaign against Huawei Technologies Co. and ZTE Corp., which has involved a series of actions aimed at limiting the Chinese manufacturers’ business in the U.S. and elsewhere, is rooted in a cybersecurity fear.
Huawei and ZTE are the world’s No. 1 and No. 4 makers of telecommunications equipment, such as the cellular-tower electronics that wireless carriers need. Washington worries that the Chinese government could order the companies to tap the products they make to spy, disable communications... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
